intro: Ulex parviflorus subsp. rivasgodayanus, commonly known as the Rivasgodayan bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Spain. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, globular fruits that resemble bladders. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are typically small and fleshy. It is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
